alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued November 25 at 2:21AM PST until November 25 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate to high risk for sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...Through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Waves can run up significantly farther on a beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties. These sneaker waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the cold ocean waters, resulting in serious injury or death. Waves may also lift driftwood logs, trapping anyone caught underneath. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest risk is expected before 10 am Saturday, November 25. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Avoid climbing on rocks and jetties. Stay away from the ocean and remain out of the water to avoid hazardous conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
